result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amari D Williams

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order.  Signed and Filed.  nk

Defendant Amari D Williams in court.  Attorney Matt Ricci in court for Amari D Williams.  Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requested final pretrial and jury trial dates. Court granted defense's request. Case adjourned for final pretrial, jury status hearing and jury trial in Branch 36. All ordered conditions of bail remain. Final pre-trial scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am. Jury status hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am. Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Amari D Williams in court, appear by video with attorney Matt Ricci, appear by video.  Student Intern Caroline Pellegrini with Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer L. Baracero.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 36.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Amari D Williams in court, appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Amari D Williams in court, appear by video.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (05-04-2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SKB, CJB, and JSW.

Defendant Amari D Williams in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Anthony White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/02/2022@01:00pm
